properties.senderName: NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 10 at 9:54PM MST until February 12 at 5:00AM MST by NWS El Paso TX/Santa Teresa NM
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM EXPECTED TO BRING HEAVY SNOW OVER MOUNTAIN
AREAS...

. Upper level closed low is expected to combine with a strong
cold front to bring winter weather conditions over the Gila
Region and Sacramento Mountains from Monday night through early
Wednesday morning. Temperatures will drop below freezing on
Monday night/early Tuesday morning which will allow the
transition from rain to snow. Periods of moderate to heavy snow
are possible with this system from Monday night through Wednesday
morning. Snow accumulations are expected to be between 6 to 10(+)
inches in the Sacramento Mountains, and areas above 7500 feet in
the Gila Region, with isolated higher amounts. The snow should end
by Wednesday morning.

* WHAT...Winter Weather Advisory for areas below 7500 feet, with
snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 3-6 inches.

* WHERE...Portions of southwest New Mexico.

* WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Wednesday.

* TIMING... Occasional moderate to heavy snow through early
Wednesday morning.

* IMPACTS... Travel could be very difficult. Some roads could
become impassable and/or closed.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST WEDNESDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED
